info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 11:06PM EDT until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of the western Piedmont of North Carolina and Upstate South Carolina, including the following areas, in the Piedmont of North Carolina, Cabarrus, Mecklenburg and Union NC. In Upstate South Carolina, Chester, Greenwood, Laurens, Union SC and York. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical cyclone Idalia will spread rain northward into the Upstate and metro Charlotte starting Wednesday afternoon and then continuing overnight, then eventually tapering off on Thursday. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches will be possible over the course of the event, mainly east of a line from Greenwood and Union, South Carolina, to Charlotte, North Carolina. Changes in the track of Idalia could result in changes to the rainfall amounts and the extent of the Watch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means there is a potential for rapid onset flooding based on current forecasts. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation and may impact areas that do not typically flood. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action quickly should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
